image.altText: Man with brown beard with road behind him

props.synopsis: More than two years on from a serious crash that saw him medically retired, a former police officer says he can still hear the screech of tyres before the deafening bang of a car slamming into his police wagon.

title.children: 'I had the uniform cut off me and it was the last time I ever wore it'

image.altText: Tyronne Garstone smiling slightly in a portrait, taken in front of a building with the Aboriginal flag printed on the side.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners in WA's north launch legal action against the state government claiming it is fast-tracking mining and exploration projects using "expedited procedure" approvals at cultural expense.

title.children: Court to test claims mining exploration fast-tracked at expense of native title

image.altText: A woman wearing a headscarf called Tahira Shaheen walks down a street being followed by cameramen and journalists.

props.synopsis: A 49-year-old L-plater who kept driving after hitting a 12-year-old as she walked to school in suburban Perth, causing serious injuries, is jailed for 16 months.

title.children: 'Callous' hit-and-run L-plater who struck 12yo on school crossing jailed

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and a man in a blue shirt look at the camera

props.synopsis: Laura Stokes and Adam Zerna describe spending time in an underground bunker as the category three cyclone passed over, before emerging to find an "apocalyptic" scene.

title.children: Caretakers huddled in bunker as ‘apocalyptic’ Cyclone Fina hit luxury lodge

image.altText: A court sketch of a man wearing a blue jacket whose dark hair is slicked back

props.synopsis: A Perth man who stabbed a woman multiple times in a "ferocious attack" before her body was found in a South Fremantle harbour has been sentenced to 20 years in prison.

title.children: Perth killer jailed for 20 years after 'shutting the door on a dying woman'

image.altText: Sophie Devine of the Scorchers hits a cut shot to the off side during a WBBL match

props.synopsis: Perth have survived a dramatic collapse to beat the Melbourne Renegades by four wickets, denying the Renegades a share of top spot on the WBBL ladder.

title.children: Scorchers survive collapse to deny Renegades share of WBBL ladder lead

image.altText: Daisy

props.synopsis: A community legal service gave Daisy the help she needed after she returned home to find her children gone — but she is one of the lucky ones, and there's a warning things are getting worse.

title.children: When Daisy lost access to her kids, she turned to the only place that could help

image.altText: The outside of a courthouse

props.synopsis: A Kimberley man has been sentenced to five years in jail after attacking a pregnant woman, forcing her to have an emergency caesarean.

title.children: WA man sentenced to five years' jail after 'brutal' attack on pregnant woman

image.altText: A pale street sign which says "May St, shire of Northam" in front of a blue sky.

props.synopsis: A small shire has taken housing for older people into its hands and taken land back from the state government.

title.children: 'Decided to take some action': Town tired of waiting for state to develop social housing

image.altText: WA Premier Roger Cook standing up at a podium full of microphones and speaking at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Roger Cook declares he has "industrial FOMO" and wants to take every opportunity to bring big projects to the state, as WA's peak legal body slams proposed new laws aimed at fast-tracking development.

title.children: Premier defends pro-development laws, wants more 'shiny, job-creating projects'

image.altText: A woman in a navy blue shirt smiles while holding her toddler-aged son, who is playing with her necklace.

props.synopsis: A mother is in disbelief after a needle she believes was used to inject drugs was thrown into her Karratha backyard.

title.children: Mother horrified to see needle thrown into backyard on CCTV

image.altText: Anthony Albanese points.

props.synopsis: The federal government's overhauled national environment laws have passed parliament. Follow live.

title.children: PM declares Labor-Greens deal a 'yesalition' as environment bill passes

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Breaking: Labor's environment protection bill passes parliament
Joyce would betray Nationals if he joined One Nation: Bridget McKenzie
Greens senator Sarah Hanson-Young says environment laws are 'a long time coming'

image.altText: A woman with long, dark hair sits in a dimly-lit room.

props.synopsis: A major review into preventing violence against women and children called for changes to immediate alcohol home delivery

title.children: Ministers must answer for inaction on alcohol laws, anti-DV advocates say

image.altText: Environment Minister Murray Watt walks in the Senate.

props.synopsis: The environmental deal is a major win for a government whose critics on the left are calling for it to be more reformist.

title.children: Greens out-step flat-footed Liberals on crucial deal

image.altText: A boy in a t shirt stands in a pool holding a long orange foam pool toy.

props.synopsis: Parents are reporting year-long waitlists for swimming lessons at public pools as drowning deaths continue to rise.

title.children: Swimming skills gap from lack of facilities in regional WA

image.altText: A Western Power worker in a harness working at heights at a power station.

props.synopsis: The WA government takes the first steps towards a proposed new electricity network for the state's Goldfields — but the region still faces a long wait for the plan to be realised.

title.children: Kalgoorlie-Boulder power solution still appears to be years away

image.altText: A red and yellow striped balloon in the air with clouds around it.

props.synopsis: A report by the national transport safety investigator finds hot air balloon rides come with a higher risk of injuries than a joy flight in a light plane or a helicopter.

title.children: Hot air balloon rides nearly 10 times riskier than helicopter or plane

image.altText: An Asian baby boy sitting on high chair while eating. Baby boy is being fed by mother at home

props.synopsis: Allergen starter kits promise to make introducing foods to babies easier, but experts are concerned they may not be effective.

title.children: Allergen starter packs are meant to take the load off parents. But do they?

image.altText: A shopper carrying a bag walks past a shop in Perth's city centre

props.synopsis: As scammers look to exploit sales during Black Friday and Cyber Monday, we explain what you need to know to avoid being duped.

title.children: How to spot a scam during Black Friday and Cyber Monday

image.altText: A firefighter fights a blaze

props.synopsis: An increased risk of bushfire is expected for parts of the country this summer, with most areas expecting hotter than normal temperatures.

title.children: Hot summer ahead leads to increased bushfire risk in parts of WA, NSW and Victoria

image.altText: Frozen Elsa Disney pic

props.synopsis: It wasn't just a box office success — Frozen introduced a new type of Disney princess: one who was strong, flawed and uninterested in romance.

title.children: Frozen flipped the script on the Disney princess narrative

image.altText: an outback pub with a sign walkabout crek hotel a young family stand under the sign, two parents, two kids

props.synopsis: Think you’ve had your ears to the ground? It’s time to test your knowledge of the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: The G20 summit, a cyclone and a very famous pub

image.altText: Alana Starkie leans down and kisses her baby, who is covered in hospital tubes.

props.synopsis: A WA family has been devastated by the death of their newborn son at Perth's premier maternity hospital, and are desperate for answers on how the delivery of their fourth child went so tragically wrong.

title.children: Parents say baby who died wasn't properly monitored during birth

image.altText: A woman stands in a party with her eyes closed as confetti rains down on her.

props.synopsis: November saw the return of two beloved franchises; magic-filled Now You See Me and action classic Predator — but can either live up to their predecessors?

title.children: Here are the November films that you need to see

image.altText: A woman with long, blonde hair is formally dressed as she sits in front of a large set of shelves.

props.synopsis: Not all Australians aged under 16 will "magically disappear overnight" from social media, the nation's online safety regulator says, amid a legal challenge to pause the start of the federal government's ban.

title.children: Social media ban implementation will 'vary' across platforms, regulator warns

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 has opened down in morning trade, with Wall Street closed for Thanksgiving. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX opens in the red as Wall St is closed

image.altText: neon strip club sign saying 'crazy horse revue' with silhoutte of a seated woman

props.synopsis: A City of Joondalup councillor, who lodged an expense claim for a drink he bought at a strip club, resigns from the council citing "personal reasons".

title.children: Councillor resigns for personal reasons after 'accidental' strip club visit

image.altText: A young man in a black hoodie outside a courthouse after appearing on a charge of grievous bodily harm.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors drop an aggravated grievous bodily harm charge against a 20-year-old man earlier accused of cutting his father's arm off with a sword.

title.children: Man accused of severing father's arm with samurai sword has charge dropped

image.altText: Alyssa Healy of Australia in a huddle, speaking to the team she captains before fielding

props.synopsis: All-rounder Deepti Sharma fetched the highest price at the Women's Premier League (WPL) auction, while Australia captain Alyssa Healy, one of the marquee players up for grabs, went unsold.

title.children: Aussie cricket captain snubbed in lucrative WPL auction

image.altText: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris at a fan day, Norris (right) speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri says McLaren raised the prospect of the Australian helping his teammate Lando Norris win the Formula 1 world championship, but it was rejected.

title.children: Piastri says helping Norris win F1 title was discussed and dismissed

image.altText: People marching while holding posters and banners about ending violence against women.

props.synopsis: Men and boys are being urged to play a part in changing the culture of violence against women and children, as the annual 16 Days in WA campaign began with a rally in the Perth CBD.

title.children: Call for men to step up and help end family and domestic violence

image.altText: Packets of illegal cigarettes displayed on a table.

props.synopsis: Convenience stores along the popular strip are scarcely stocked with chocolate bars and chewing gum but it's the merchandise under the counter that's really paying the rent.

title.children: How illegal tobacco traders continue to ply their trade on renowned cafe strip

image.altText: Two young boys on a detention centre roof.

props.synopsis: For most, the absence of youth detention from the headlines after years of chaos would have been an indication things were working well — but Monday's troubling disturbance shows just how much still needs to be done.

title.children: Minister, experts divided on whether Banksia Hill disturbances can be stopped
